basics.name: Ryan Seymour
basics.label: Game Developer & E-Learning Coordinator
basics.summary: Seeking opportunities to expand game design knowledge and to collaborate on engaging, educational games.

courses: Museum Manager, Augmented Reality simulation game
Tour of Williamsburg, Virtual Reality 3D modeling of historical buildings
Toxicity, 3D Digital Game of immune response
Sprouts, Boardgame relating to farming and resource management
Darwin's Angry Finches, Boardgame teaching natural selection
Fantasy Taxonomy, Card game teaching taxonomy
Gender Analysis of Video Game Play, Thesis

work.summary: Managed a student worker digital game training project, developing a scope of work, assessing solutions and directing project outcomes.  Coordinated the pilot project for the learning management system upgrade, assessing stakeholder input and developing project recommendations. Provided faculty and student support and technical assistance with the school’s e-learning resources. Collaborated with faculty members to develop and design digital content and integrate coursework into the learning management system. Implemented new digital learning tools, such as online testing and video presentations, to enhance classroom interactive experiences. Developed and presented technical training seminars and support documents on education technology systems. Managed updates to division’s website and Blackboard database. Project manager for student training and professional development needs.

work.position: Executive Assistant to the Dean of Undergraduate Education
work.summary: Simplified student petition processing through managing a collaborative project involving advisors, deans and Sharepoint programmers.  Advanced from Administrative Assistant to Executive Assistant in one year. Provided support to the Living Learning Communities, including program development and outreach. Managed special events, meetings, scheduling and travel planning for the Office of Undergraduate Studies. Managed workflows for various processes such as purchase orders, student retention, and course transfer articulation. Facilitated student inquiries regarding scholar and award programs, advising and petitions. Served as the primary customer service contact for the office, handling walk-in, telephone and e-mail inquiries in a friendly, prompt manner. Collaborated with faculty and staff to develop online presentations for honors course topics. Supervised one student worker.

Coordinated the school’s accreditation process by delegating tasks, analyzing documents and developing a final report.  Managed my program’s largest increase in students by streamlining the advising and testing process and improving teacher training and hiring standards.  Advanced from ESL Instructor to Program Coordinator to Assistant Director over three years. Supervised teachers, administrative staff and student workers, including training, recruitment, scheduling and performance reviews. Advised ESL students on academic and extracurricular opportunities. Administered digital TOEFL and English placement assessment tests. Created and analyzed databases to track and verify student and staff policy compliance. Organized special events, including student receptions, guest speakers and field trips. Created active learning experiences through visiting the Smithsonian Institution museums.

highlights: Fluvanna Middle School,Life Science Student Teacher, 2012
